column1: Sadly amidst COVID-19 we’ve seen the rise of another pandemic—violence against women. Today and every day I’m standing with survivors and asking my colleagues to join me in supporting legislation to address this global crisis. https://t.co/u5ndx5sLux

Week in Review:  ☑️COVID cases are rising. I'm glad Senator Mitch McConnell has finally acknowledge the dire need for a deal. I will continue working to pass a relief package  ☑️Helped pass 2 bills that work towards ending the opioid epidemic in PA and across the country https://t.co/QixMq8xO7o

We are in the midst of a public health and economic crisis. We've been here for months.   No matter which side of the aisle we stand on we have a collective responsibility to address the COVID-19 pandemic.  Hardworking Pennsylvanians need federal support to weather this crisis. https://t.co/ieG3wXJJM9

COVID cases and hospitalizations are rising across our county. We need to pass a comprehensive relief package that contains this virus supports our frontline health care workers and begins to rebuild our economy with an emphasis on our small business community.
Passing a COVID relief deal is crucial and I will continue working with my colleagues - Republican and Democrat - to deliver much-needed relief to Pennsylvanians. https://t.co/PcDs1LiPhE

#ElectionDay is just hours away! Are you voting in person tomorrow? Remember to:  ↔️ Social distance 🖊️Bring your own blue or black pen 🧼Wash your hands 😷Wear a mask  On behalf of our counties' dedicated poll workers and volunteers thank you for voting safely! https://t.co/209q5WT9ot

In August I joined a bipartisan group of colleagues to ask @USDA Sec. Perdue to extend flexibilities for school nutrition programs because of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. I'm grateful he took our request seriously and granted extension on October 9th. Read his full response: https://t.co/crYuGo84vb

Week in Review:  👩‍🍳Safely visited small businesses in our community including local Reading favorite Mi Casa Su Casa to hear how the pandemic has affected business ☑️Continued pushing Republicans and Democrats to reach a deal for COVID relief 🗳️Hosted our 6th voting town hall https://t.co/L6q2Fk191B

The House has passed 2 bills to deliver additional relief to Americans. Meanwhile Senate Republicans passed ZERO bills to address additional relief and now they're also pressing the White House to ignore COVID legislation until after the election! /1  https://t.co/tsZL1c8bfb

Week in Review:  🍎Visited small businesses in our community including a quarry and an orchard 😷Continued to work with Democrats and Republicans on COVID relief 🗳️Hosted two town halls about the importance of voting and how to do so safely. Thanks to @PAAttorneyGen for joining! https://t.co/4skZLHinUg

My dad & grandfather were career Naval Officers so I grew up knowing the challenges military families face. Today I'm joining the 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit to discuss COVID's impact on our military families' education health care and more. Registration info below! ⬇️ https://t.co/hAh4U31rBe

At the quarry I even witnessed one of their planned rock explosions! Very cool. We also discussed how even though their business has mostly regained its footing since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic they are concerned that construction projects will dry up. 2/ https://t.co/lPCt5oYg3n

Week in Review:  😷Passed another round of COVID relief through the House. This legislation included my bipartisan initiative to help streamline forgiveness for small businesses receiving PPP loans of under $150000.  🗳️Held our third Voting Safely in 2020 town hall https://t.co/YmNMCpecDM

Last night we passed another round of COVID relief through the House of Representatives!   From the start of this pandemic I have worked hard with colleagues on both sides of the aisle to deliver desperately needed relief into the hands of Pennsylvanians. /1

😷 On COVID relief I stand firm in my commitment that we should not adjourn this Congress until we get a deal. I encourage us all to reach across the aisle and continue negotiating to deliver results to the American people

As I vote on key programs to support #PA06 during this COVID crisis I’m reminded of my recent visit w/ @BrandyHealthFdn. They provide health and social services to those in need addressing issues of food insecurity tech barriers affordable housing & access to quality care. 1/ https://t.co/w9wIQQbRAH

Week In Review: ☑️ Standing with my colleagues to keep the House in session until we reach a COVID deal 🗳️ Launched our "Voting Safely in 2020" town hall series 🦸‍♂️ Commended local heroes on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives https://t.co/nuvQXW4UPq

.@UNICEF reports at least 24 million children are projected to drop out of school due to COVID. I introduced the bipartisan & bicameral Global Learning Loss Assessment Act b/c we need to know the impacts of the pandemic on learning & access to education.   https://t.co/OCwI2CyUH3

Looking for a way to get involved in the election? If you're not in a high risk category for COVID consider signing up to become a poll worker. Our poll workers are critical to ensuring a safe and fair election.   For more information: https://t.co/hqcHASI4Tn

Our counties' voter services need help! We depend on #pollworkers to ensure a fair and safe election. If you're not in a high risk group for COVID consider signing up today to become a poll worker or language interpreter and get compensated for your time! https://t.co/VAdbobsxvg https://t.co/T2LwBjojkb

For years our @CoatesvilleVAMC has received national recognition for the quality care they provide our deserving veterans. So it's no surprise these local health care heroes are being honored. Thank you for all your work to mitigate COVID-19!   https://t.co/r9LMavGEsp

We are facing multiple crises at once. As we grapple with the coronavirus pandemic and a national reckoning with racial injustice we cannot forget that the climate crisis is reaching a boiling point.  We need climate action now.  Read more in my Op-Ed: https://t.co/AJKrEXvxyf

Experts agree: we must take the necessary precautions ahead of flu season including getting your flu shot. COVID-19 and flu symptoms overlap so fewer flu cases means more resources for our frontline medical professionals. #FightFlu @CDCFlu 2/2 https://t.co/sjmHvFwykl

It is urgent because COVID-19 disproportionately affects Black and Latinx communities; because the police violence against Black communities which King described 57 years ago persists; and because Black women in Pennsylvania earn 66 cents on the dollar compared to white men.

At a recent #gunviolence round table I spoke w/ local residents about how COVID-19 has affected trends in gun violence and death by suicide-particularly for groups already at a high risk. As we consider future legislation we must prioritize resources to keep our community safe.

We are safer from disease outbreaks when we invest in proactive measures globally. As we continue to combat COVID-19 I will keep pushing the Administration to work with our partners around the world. 3/3

I recently met w/ business leaders representing our district & regional Chambers of Commerce to talk about what they're seeing on the ground as our community works to safely reopen. We also discussed priorities for our next COVID-19 relief package. Grateful for the conversation!

Our seniors need us now more than ever which is why I helped pass legislation through the House that would ensure the 50000 seniors on Medicare Advantage in Chester and Berks counties won’t see higher costs due to COVID-19. #NationalSeniorCitizensDay

House Democrats have voted for an additional $200 billion in hazard pay funding. We need Congressional Republicans to come to the negotiating table to unlock further relief for all Americans struggling with the effects of COVID-19 especially our essential workers. 2/

This is alarming–nearly 80% of our veterans receive medications by 📬. Delays could be costly. I’ve spoken w/ countless veterans who are tired of partisanship when it comes to health care. We must stand w/ them to ensure no cuts to service during COVID-19. https://t.co/jilVg0XfBm

Both sides agree: state and local officials deserve reasonable flexibility to help our communities address the pandemic. We in PA are asking House leadership to extend the deadline for states and localities to spend COVID-19 relief funds until Dec. of 2021. Our bipartisan letter: https://t.co/6ZPR7wlpwO

Week in Review:  ❗️The Senate has still failed to meet this moment and produce a COVID relief package  ☢️Introduced legislation to find safe alternatives to dangerous PFAS chemicals  💡Responded to concerns about the power outages caused by this week’s storm https://t.co/GZ08j0Gtdg

☑️ Passed the bipartisan Securing America from Epidemics (SAFE) Act through the Foreign Affairs Committee. The United States needs to actively engage with the international community on combating COVID-19 and this bill helps us do exactly that 3/3

Week in Review:  ❗️ The Senate has failed to vote through a COVID relief package which we in the House did over 2 months ago  ✅ Helped pass 2 bipartisan child care support bills - it's crucial that we support PA's child care centers as parents navigate these uncertain times /1 https://t.co/oEnnpcW1Rq

The COVID-19 outbreak at Southeastern Veterans’ Center has broken the hearts of many in our community. We owe it to our veterans especially those that still live in that facility to do everything in our power to prevent this from happening again. https://t.co/46vFMUS7HB
By joining CEPI the United States would be taking a proactive step towards fortifying itself against viruses like COVID-19. /6

This particular legislation which I also helped pass through the HEROES Act in May has ramifications beyond those of COVID-19. What has been painstakingly clear is that we as a nation were woefully unprepared for a pandemic of this proportion. /4

As we continue to face this global pandemic it's critical that the United States actively engage w/ the international community including the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) to rapidly and safely develop manufacture & distribute a COVID-19 vaccine. /2

During this COVID-19 crisis many Pennsylvanian families have had to adapt to a new way of life and as our economy begins to reopen it’s crucial that our child care facilities are adequately funded so they’re able to safely care for our children. 2/
Happening soon! We will be discussing projects and project leaders in health agriculture and off-grid energy specifically innovative responses to the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/W8Hvg5QiaR
Ran into a few familiar PA faces last week from both sides of the aisle. They wanted to join me in reminding you all to #MaskUp social distance and wash those hands! https://t.co/4kExjxRxO3

Our small businesses have a lot of 'grit' (@GrittyNHL). I’m so excited to see our @NHLFlyers supporting local small businesses impacted by COVID-19 with free advertising packages! Apply through August 2nd📲  https://t.co/rV7UAEx3ko

The #COVID19 pandemic is public health economic and social crisis. I firmly believe national service has a role to play in helping us weather this crisis as a nation. #Stand4Service   https://t.co/U7ZKTXMibL

Join us tomorrow at 10:05am for a Coronavirus Telephone Town Hall ☎️ I’ll be joined by public health experts in our community to discuss Federal and local updates and answer your questions on the pandemic.   To participate dial: (855) 731-4616 https://t.co/k5uDYbVt4B

I firmly believe our small businesses represent the backbone of our economy. To successfully navigate this COVID-19 pandemic we in Congress need to continue working with and supporting our small businesses.
Your voice is your vote. As we continue to combat the COVID-19 pandemic I am encouraging you to vote from home if possible. Apply today! https://t.co/BFWIn2jMk2
Next Thursday morning we are hosting a coronavirus telephone town with public health experts from our community. To join dial (855) 731-4616. https://t.co/ze4Fi7P37s

PA COVID-19 Hazard Pay Grants are now available to help employers provide hazard pay to employees on the front lines during this pandemic. To check your eligibility and apply by July 31st: https://t.co/7drk2lB5hj

I'm honored to be recognized as a 2020 Medicare Advantage Breakthrough Champion by @BMAlliance ! More than 60000 seniors in our community are enrolled in MA and I'm working hard to ensure that we keep healthcare affordable for our seniors especially during the COVID-19 crisis.

Weekly Rundown:  ☎️ Hosted a telephone town hall with more than 2000 of our community members; we talked about #COVID19 criminal justice and more  🪖 Working on protecting Pennsylvanians through the NDAA  ☑️ Voted for the bipartisan George Floyd Justice in Policing Act of 2020 https://t.co/IhuOGeIY3R

Happening now! Chester County is offering COVID-19 nasal swab testing free of charge. The Health Dept. has done a great job at spreading out locations all over Chester--take a look!  Register and find details here: https://t.co/5snGQJpuFU https://t.co/lOODpZ97Kj

Pennsylvania is one of only a handful of states in the country with a continued downward trend in COVID-19 cases. Our precautions are paying off! One week from today we will be moving to green phase. https://t.co/qVAJf5ITsk

Over the past year I've loved exploring Kennett Square--the Mushroom Festival last year was so fun! If you're looking to support #smallbusinesses on this ⛅️ summer evening head to their main street 6-10pm. Don't forget to wear a mask and social distance! https://t.co/BoVXeEX7Yq

Systemic racism is also what’s occurring as black and brown people succumb in disproportionate numbers to COVID 19.   Our society is one where people of color may not be able to be safe in a park or on the streets or may not have access to quality health care. /2

We also just launched a 📲 webpage that outlines a comprehensive list of our #coronavirus efforts—take a look! In the midst of this crisis as always it is an honor and privilege to serve.  https://t.co/JtFBLBdx5m…/coronav…/legislation-action.htm

ICYMI (I don’t blame you 11PM is even late for me these days) here’s my conversation with @Lawrence. We discussed my new bipartisan bill to establish a new branch of #nationalservice--a National Public Health Corps--to meet this moment and help our country through #COVID19. https://t.co/ExMjAZmjzY

Just wrapped up our 8th Coronavirus Virtual Town Hall with nearly 3000 people from our community! This is a difficult time for many which is why I convened a panel of specialists on #mentalhealth to join us and answer your questions. We will post the full audio recording 🔜. https://t.co/IIZPhLm45E

Looking forward to joining @Lawrence on @TheLastWord in a few minutes to discuss my bipartisan effort to establish a new branch of national service - the National Public Health Corps - to help fight this #COVID19 pandemic. Tune in! 📺

It’s been clear from the beginning that this #Coronavirus disproportionately affects communities of color. This #MinorityHealthMonth I remain committed to making quality health care accessible and affordable to all especially for our most vulnerable communities.

Frontline workers deserve our support for their service to our country during this #coronavirus pandemic. Last week I helped pass a bill that provides resources to 🏥 hospitals and 🩺 health care workers. Our community is stronger thanks to your sacrifice. #ThankYou https://t.co/kVHnYazaQF

For our next #Coronavirus Virtual Town Hall we will be joined by Dr. Benjamin Abella Vice Chair of the Department of Emergency Medicine at @PennMedicine.  We'll be taking your questions throughout. Join us:  📅 Wednesday April 29th  ⏰ 10:00 - 11:00AM 📍   Facebook Live! https://t.co/hjK2fKluWN
Disinfectant has a role in fighting coronavirus - cleaning surfaces. It has no role in your body. That’s all.
I just voted for a bipartisan stimulus package that supports our hospitals health care workers and small businesses across our community. #CoronavirusRelief https://t.co/30hfiu2S8R

Today I joined my colleagues on the Foreign Affairs Committee in a virtual briefing with pandemic experts on the global response to #COVIDー19. We discussed the importance of international cooperation evidence-based policies scientific data and the potential for a vaccine.

These past few weeks have been incredibly challenging and we want to update you all on how we've been fighting for families in our region. Join us @ 4PM today for a Facebook live update on #COVID19. Join us on my Facebook page! https://t.co/HOqeDI8uW3 https://t.co/HqMTyppADQ

Weekly Rundown:   👴 After hearing from a constituent on our 5th #coronavirus telephone town hall about rebates for those on social security I took action to make sure that they receive their CARES Act benefits   🩸 Gave blood ➡️ I encourage all who are eligible to give to do so https://t.co/2S0xCNDE5N

This week's rundown:  ⚕️ Spoke to the head of the CDC about the coronavirus  🚁Helped bring new work to our Coatesville Sikorsky plant #jobs 🇺🇸 Introduced a bipartisan national service bill with @RepMichaelWaltz  👩‍🏫Excited to launch March's Education Month https://t.co/Sls9mvwnxy
